subtitle: Welcome back to Astral Doorway, in this episode I will be giving a sort of synthesized summarized
step-by-step method of how I approach Astral projection. If you are not a subscriber to the
channel please go ahead so we can explore the wonderful world of Astral projection together
... before I do that i just want to say thank you to the few people who have left reviews on my book
it brought a big smile to my face to read them you guys clearly understood the essence of the book
and the teachings there and enjoyed it so thank you for leaving those comments and I wish you the
best of luck for your practice. So first of all I want to express that as the rational intellectual
mammals that we all are we're always looking for methods and techniques for almost everything new
we learn in this case we often treat Astral projection like a microwave meal where you
just read a step-by-step manual and bish bash bosh you're all done right? Well you know you can't
just approach astral projection like that i'm not saying it's not easy it can be very easy
and simple if you're more of an instinctive and intuitive person who doesn't overthink the process
so what i'm saying is you have to understand astral projection is something very profound
and only realized when you're willing to let go of your current fears and preconceptions related
to the practice, to awaken your consciousness literally outside of your physical body with your
full senses intact is a monumental feat in reality that most people will never consciously experience
and some people think it takes too much effort i say sure but it's completely
worth it i don't see any reason as to why you shouldn't practice it to be honest, we're in the
age of a radical revolution of consciousness and we should act accordingly with vigor and
strength to journey into the unknown with all our spiritual yearning and curiosity as the fuel to
go beyond our conventional thought patterns and transcend old paradigms of thinking
so my advice is where possible don't rely too much on step-by-step methods
if you do that it ultimately just leaves you asking, "why isn't it working?" - if you're left
asking yourself excessively "why isn't it working?" and you get upset frustrated or disappointed
about the fact that it's not working, or that you think it's not working because you're not being
patient enough, then you're basically missing the point of the practice which is to be in a state
of non-expectation, non-thinking, non-analyzing right? to be in a profound meditative state, not
putting excessive egoic expectation on it and just putting in the work without complaining... you know
just carrying on and you know if you continue on like this it's highly likely that you will succeed
so rather relying on step-by-step guides rely on discipline motivation, inspiration, patience and
intention - even with just these traits you can achieve it, seriously; with intention alone for
example i recently joined the spiritual forums website and offered my help in the astral
projection section and someone called astralsuzy really liked my astral projection motivation
video and she said she basically repeatedly watched that video until she actually projected
which she did and eventually came out of body you can see her message on the screen now
this is just one example of when someone is highly motivated and can achieve whatever they want
simply through motivation it's like the law of attraction right? if you really want it
it will happen the things will fall into place into your life and you will know
what is right for you so i could just leave this video here right? that's all you need to know
but of course we need to entertain our logical minds in some way and i'll give my step-by-step
guide here, and just think you know if there was some ultimate or definitive instruction
on how to astral project then we would have many more astral projectors in the world wouldn't we?
however astral projection is more based on a level of consciousness that allows it to happen rather
than thinking about ways that it can happen, so this attitude of approaching astral projection
in a wholesome and spiritual way with motivation, willpower and intention instead
of just a half-hearted egotistical experiment, is how we should prioritize the way we approach
the practice and this is something i go in-depth into in my book you know honestly ask yourself why
you want to ask your project - is it so you can gain superpowers and think you're cool? maybe you want
some interesting experiences so you can show off to others make a youtube channel like me...
maybe you want to feel like a god you know? or maybe you want to become enlightened like the
buddha; these are ultimately egoic reasons because you're wanting to become more than you are now and
that's not really the direction true enlightenment is about - the true path is about
becoming aware of what you are right now and then going beyond that - it's about a disintegration
of your current preconceptions about reality and breaking them you know? becoming more
does not happen by wanting - it happens by surrendering and letting go
by dying to what you are now, and that involves giving up on childish and immature dreams or
ambitious dreams no matter how spiritual they are, you know in extreme cases uh frankly i can't
stand narcissistic people who call themselves god because they can astral project or something
astral projection is natural to every living creature just because you can ask your project
does not mean you are enlightened or psychic or clairvoyant, no, one can be extremely egotistical
and still have the ability, trust me, the people who live from love, who are virtuous
and help others in their life are in for a much better afterlife than those who vainly seek
spiritual abilities for their own sake; the primary underlying attitudes towards astral projection
should be from the purest aspects and teachings of our heart right? and from all religions throughout
antiquity you know including christianity, buddhism, islam
hinduism right? you know there is a gnostic teacher who says that "all religions are precious pearls
strung on the golden thread of divinity" and so our primary underlying attitudes in this practice
should be the pure aspects from those teachings such as christianity, taoism, zen buddhism
eastern and western philosophies, you know, the real teaching is from love and with the goal
of awakening consciousness and also with the intention of helping others on the way
so with that said here is my step-by-step method; number one; be interested and passionate read books
meditate and watch videos on astral projection just like this, one study it and contemplate it in
a lot of your free time. number two; always question your reality as often as you can ask, yourself
throughout the day "Am I in the Astral?" do reality checks to confirm - as i've said in previous videos
my favorite reality check is to hold my nose shut and try to breathe through them if i can't then
i'm in the physical, if i can then i'm either in the astral plane or in a dream, if i'm in a dream
then i will use the flying or falling technique to induce vibrations to enter the astral plane
this technique is discussed in my video on how to turn a lucid dream into astral projection which
is on the screen now, number three; before sleeping set an alarm for you to wake up anywhere between
four and six hours of sleep - you can test what is the best time for you over the course of several
days it's no problem personally i usually have my most success after six hours of sleep but
i've also had success with three hours, four hours etc now when you go to sleep you're going to set
intentions to astral project when you first go to bed right? but waking up in the middle of the night
and then going back to sleep will also act as a second attempt by giving a jolt to
your consciousness and actually when you go to sleep during the second time in the middle of
the night you're probably going to have a much better chance of being successful because of
REM cycles and also the fact that you're very sleepy and lethargic so you won't be
overthinking the process; people usually have a lot more success in the middle of the night like
this, so when you wake up in the middle of your sleep simply walk around a bit or preferably
meditate while sitting up, you can stay awake for anywhere between five minutes to
half an hour but the important thing here is to stay feeling drowsy and sleepy so that you can
easily fall back to sleep, in this state your body basically stays asleep and you should be intending
for your mind to stay somewhat aware of what is happening - don't go off in thoughts and dreams just
center yourself and ground yourself, step number four; as you drift off to sleep both when you first
go to sleep and during the middle of your night attempt, say affirmations such as "I will Astral
project", "I will be conscious while my physical body sleeps", or "I will travel to where I intend to go
once I'm out of body" - you can say these mentally or you can say these out loud as well if that helps
but you must feel this emotionally when you say it - you must feel it in your body in every cell
of your being, desire it, crave it, will it; do not say it robotically you know? believe every word
wholeheartedly as if you're praying - you know don't say it like "i will astral project~i will
astral project" you know it is so much more effective to say it once with
conviction, belief and faith rather than saying it 100 times robotically and unconsciously
now, this is basically step four and a half because it's an optional one as i know some people
won't be as open to it but if you are comfortable with mentally reciting mantras as you sleep i
was taught by my Gnostic teacher the following mantra which i have had much success; with it goes
"FA RA ON" - and with this mantra you lull yourself to sleep with it and as you do
you see in your mind's eye the Egyptian Pyramids of Giza and you lay on your back
with your knees bent upwards so that your legs form a pyramid and with your arms rested
at your side like what you can see on the screen, and as you do this, without knowing how
as you fall to sleep you will spontaneously find yourself in the astral plane at some point
whether you experience coming out of the body or you just find yourself becoming conscious at
any point during the night - the mantra is separated by a breath each time so it's pronounced like this; "FFAA, RAAA, OONNN"
don't ask me how this works, it's just one of those things, it just works; we're always
looking for explanations to the mysteries of life that's what science is for and it's great but not
everything needs an explanation especially an intellectual explanation which barely
does the reality of spiritual mysteries justice this mantra was believed to have been used by
pharaohs in ancient Egypt to leave the body... if you think this is weird then simply don't do it
it's not for you... if you can't get comfortable in the position i mentioned
then don't worry you can still astral project from any position it really doesn't matter
but this position does help with focus and consciously controlling the body, you know not
letting it just move around automatically, unconsciously, impulsively all the time
right that's that's something a lot of people forget in this practice that we
need to also discipline the body a little bit; how can you expect to control your astral body
if you can't control your physical body in waking life? so if you do want to try to use this position
but you struggle falling asleep in it then perhaps try some breathing meditation before you do this
so you feel tired or try this position when you go back to sleep in the middle of the night because
that way you should already feel tired and you should easily be able to fall back to sleep
so number six; either as you fall to sleep when you first go to bed or in the middle of your night's
attempt you may begin to feel vibrations - do not panic or get over excited or start analyzing or
thinking - be like a zen monk go with the flow and allow whatever new experiences or sensations
to unfold naturally and remember your goal; you may begin to feel your whole body is being sort of
electrocuted not in a painful way it's just in a extrasensory way and you may hear loud sounds
as well, and you may even see swirling colors in your vision during this time all these sensations
will start to peak and you will eventually be able to simply WILL yourself out of your body
you can lean into those sensations and simply get up or float up or roll out or just intend to stand
in a location in your room, but essentially just don't overthink the exiting stage; just simply get
up as you usually would but not with the physical body if you are struggling this may take a bit of
force so simply force yourself out with strength and vigor like you're pushing through a brick wall
this may not always be effective though and if you notice the hypnagogic sensations fade then simply
go back to your natural state and wait for the sensations to come back and then attempt
to exit the body when they seem to hit their peak again but just remember this is not something you
need to think about - all of the exiting stages and phases will happen naturally so step number seven
once you're out again do not overthink anything remain like a zen monk and just get outside of
your house this can be your first mission to just get outside or you know just carry out your desire
to achieve what you originally set out to do, if you had no prior intent then simply just walk
explore and appreciate your surroundings - visual appreciation and calmly enjoying the experience
around you keeps you grounded, step number eight; when you wake up don't move your physical body
if you do it's fine but just stay still once you remember that you have to recall your experiences
and once you're still just close your eyes and replay the entire experience in your memory
in detail go through every step and try to note down even all the insignificant details such as
the color of objects in a room, whether it was daytime or night time, what the weather was like...
you can even draw scenes that you saw you - will find that as you recall more details
even more in-depth details will come flooding into your memory - if you didn't ask your project
you must still record all of your dreams no matter how insignificant you think they are
every dream and every detail you manage to recall the stronger you enforce your
connection to the non-physical dimension and your memory of it which ultimately boosts your chances
of astral projection in the future, and number nine; above all if nothing happens that is fine - every
attempt on this path is progress your subconscious learns no matter what - patience is crucial
we sleep every day which means you have every day to practice the average lifespan is over 70 years
old there are over 25'000 days in 70 years so you have at least 25'000 attempts, every night
you don't do it is basically a night wasted, i mean what else are you going to do when you go to sleep?
nothing, you might as well make better use of your time and astral project, if you are truly patient
and have faith that you will eventually astral project i guarantee; it will happen.
so that's it - and if you're wondering how long it will take for you to achieve this and you
keep asking yourself, "when will it happen?" well it's less about how quick it can happen and more about
one's skill to achieve a level of consciousness where astral projection flows naturally
that level of consciousness is best found in relaxation and meditation - not thinking - in such a
meditative state one would never ask or wonder how long it takes because such a question implies that
one is trying to reach a particular state ~ yet the mind of the astral projector only reaches
their astral state through allowing and accepting whatever state they are already in, and thus the
astral projection phenomena flows naturally, of course it takes practice to understand what i'm
saying completely... and you know since we're all infinitely unique there's no definitive time that
it takes to achieve astral projection, it entirely depends on the individual the point is; this is
nothing to worry about or think about - all you need to do is practice and in your practice you will
likely find yourself in states of consciousness where your mind does not ask such a question so
stay in that frame of mind and patiently wait for the day you experience it - it will happen... and enjoy
whatever you learn on the way the whole path of astral projection is a learning experience so
enjoy it and don't question it too much and don't doubt it if you're on this path - it's a great path
and you'll learn a lot on the way if you don't doubt yourself - so i hope this helps let me know
if you have any questions and if you have success with it please let me know in the comments below
best of luck with your practice and i'll see you on the next episode
